page.title: 14SHOPPING:NORTH NORFOLK:Cont
page.content: In addition each village has a well-stocked general store offering a friendly, more personal service. Although in towns the current trend is to patronise supermarkets, village stores, which may open for between 11 and 12 hours daily, still play an important role in country areas, where transport may not be available. People will often pay a higher price for the sake of convenience. {SHOPPING IN NORTH NORFOLK Meat may be bought pre-packed at a supermarket, where exact cut and weight can be chosen. Fresh meat can be bought at a butcher's, whilst a travelling butcher visits the villages once or twice a week. Cooked meat and sausages can be bought at the delicatessen counter of a supermarket.
